Authors:
Debora Cervieri Guterres, Roberto Ramos Sobrinho, Danilo
Batista Pinho, Iraildes Pereira Assuncao, Gaus Silvestre Andrade
Lima
Title:
A new species of Balansia (Clavicipitaceae) parasitizing a
cyperaceous plant in Brazil
Keywords:
Ascomycota, Sordariomycetes, Hypocreales, Taxonomy,
Tropical fungi.
Abstract:
Recently, specimens of balansoid fungi were collected on
Scleria bracteata (Cyperaceae). Among the 36 species of Balansia
described worldwide, ten are reported in Brazil. While most of species
of balansoid fungi were described on graminaceous hosts only four were
reported on cyperaceous host. In the present paper we provide a detailed
account of the balansoid fungus found on S. bracteata and describe it as
a new Balansia species based on its morphology and phylogenetic
study.
